definition: to appear on camera/to play a role in a film

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc

sentences.english: What do you think about that Zhao Yazhi was nakedness for public utility?
sentences.chinese: 趙雅芝裸體出鏡，晚節不保還是爲公益獻身？

sentences.english: They were never paid for the appearance, Jeyaraj insists.
sentences.chinese: 賈亞拉賈堅稱，他們從未因這次出鏡而得到報酬。

sentences.english: So where was the captain while Calypso roved?
sentences.chinese: 那麼，當卡里普索出鏡的同時，康斯塔船長在哪裏？

sentences.english: The final version of the standup should be confirmed by the director.
sentences.chinese: 最終的出鏡版本由導演確認。

sentences.english: Got a mirror first Chen time, play to impress.
sentences.chinese: 陳超得到了初次出鏡時機，扮演出彩。

sentences.english: "Now, thanks to China, I have the shots I need to get jobs in America," Trepte said.
sentences.chinese: 多虧了中國，我纔能有在美國出鏡的機會。

sentences.english: Doing something false, just for the sake of visibility, never works.
sentences.chinese: 僅僅爲了出鏡率而做錯事，從來都不會有好結果。

sentences.english: A film opening, Bardot nude appearance on.
sentences.chinese: 影片一開場，芭鐸就裸體出鏡。

definition: currently popular (of movie stars, singers etc)
to show oneself/to appear/(of a deity) to appear in the flesh
(of a performer) to come onto the stage to perform/(of an athlete) to enter the arena to compete/(fig.) to enter the scene (e.g. a new product)/(of an examinee etc) to leave the venue
